DataElement.preferredName: Subject Recovery Prior Negation Hematologic Treatment Regimen Eligibility Determination Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating the patient meets the eligibility requirements for participation in a clinical trial with regards to being recovered from the prior non-hematologic treatment regimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Subject Recovery Prior Negation Hematologic Treatment Regimen Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Some matter, situation, or event that is thought about, written about, or discussed.:A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury._Earlier in time or order._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Some matter, situation, or event that is thought about, written about, or discussed.

Concepts.definition: Some matter, situation, or event that is thought about, written about, or discussed.

Property.preferredName: Recovery Prior Negation Hematologic Treatment Regimen Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury._Earlier in time or order._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

Concepts.definition: A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient recovered from the prior non-hematologic treatment regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient fully recovered from the acute toxic effects of anti-cancer agents not known to be myelosuppressive (e.g. not associated with reduced platelet or ANC counts)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient fully recovered from the acute non-hematologic toxic effects of all prior anti-cancer therapy as defined in the protocol?

DataElement.changeDescription: Updated WF and Ref Status - bsm; Workflow and Registration Status Changed per Brenda Duggan; 05.16.18; AALL1621
